collectors.title: Database
collectors.titleDetails: (19 total Queries, 19 of them unique across 1 Connection)

queries.sql: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>1. Obtain schedules for other expenditure and losses which include lead schedules for:</p> <ul> <li>Distribution costs;</li> <li>Administrative expenses;</li> <li>Interest payable and similar charges. <strong>(P)</strong></li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.16 R2-1', '2.16 R2-1', '35', 'Active', '2024-03-21 21:36:23')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>2. Ensure a schedule is prepared which separately shows expenses and losses recognised in profit or loss relating to financial instruments, split between:</p> <ul> <li>Financial assets measured at fair value through profit or loss;</li> <li>Financial liabilities measured at fair value through profit or loss;</li> <li>Financial assets measured on an amortised cost basis; and </li> <li>Financial liabilities measured on an amortised cost basis. <strong>(P)</strong></li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.16 R2-1', '2.16 R2-1', '35', 'Active', '2024-03-21 21:36:23')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>3. Agree the totals shown on the lead schedules to the trial balance. <strong>(A)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.16 R2-1', '2.16 R2-1', '35', 'Active', '2024-03-21 21:36:23')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>4. Agree comparative figures to the previous period’s statutory financial statements.<strong> (P, C)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.16 R2-1', '2.16 R2-1', '35', 'Active', '2024-03-21 21:36:23')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>5. Ensure that all items are correctly recognised in profit or loss rather than other comprehensive income.<strong> (P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.16 R2-1', '2.16 R2-1', '35', 'Active', '2024-03-21 21:36:23')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>6. Consider the appropriateness of the allocation of expenditure between the expense classifications noted above and also direct costs. <strong>(P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.16 R2-1', '2.16 R2-1', '35', 'Active', '2024-03-21 21:36:23')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>7. Review other expenses for reasonableness and consistency. <strong>(C)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.16 R2-1', '2.16 R2-1', '35', 'Active', '2024-03-21 21:36:23')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>8. Revisit the risk assessment, materiality calculation and assignment plan and update as appropriate where matters have been identified during the assignment.</p>', '', '', '', '2.16 R2-1', '2.16 R2-1', '35', 'Active', '2024-03-21 21:36:23')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>9. Ensure key findings from this section are included in the draft letter of representation, points for the management letter and points for A.E.P.’s attention.</p>', '', '', '', '2.16 R2-1', '2.16 R2-1', '35', 'Active', '2024-03-21 21:36:23')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>10. Ensure that the conclusion is appropriate.<strong> (P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.16 R2-1', '2.16 R2-1', '35', 'Active', '2024-03-21 21:36:23')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>11. Consider the results of the scrutiny tests completed in the I section. <strong>(CL, A, P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.16 R2-1', '2.16 R2-1', '35', 'Active', '2024-03-21 21:36:23')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>Walkthrough</h6>\r\n<p>12. Undertake one walkthrough test for each system in operation (this must cover the transaction and associated controls). Use the results, along with results of payables testing, to decide whether to replace some or all tests of detail with detailed analytical procedures. <strong>(A)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.16 R2-1', '2.16 R2-1', '35', 'Active', '2024-03-21 21:36:23')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>Detailed analytical procedures</h6>\r\n<p>13. Perform detailed analytical procedures as applicable to the client. E.g. proof in total, ratio analysis (comparing periods and similar entities). <strong>(C, CL, A)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.16 R2-1', '2.16 R2-1', '35', 'Active', '2024-03-21 21:36:23')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>Tests of detail</h6> <p>14. Trace a sample of expenses from the nominal ledger (covering, administration, distribution and finance related costs) to either:</p> <ul> <li>the purchase ledger and the purchase day book; or</li> <li>cash book; or</li> <li>journal book; and</li> <li>then to supporting documentation. <strong> (O, A)</strong></li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.16 R2-1', '2.16 R2-1', '35', 'Active', '2024-03-21 21:36:23')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>15. For a sample of purchases trace from originating documents (orders, contracts etc.) and agree, where applicable to:</p> <ul> <li> goods received note;</li> <li> purchase invoice;</li> <li> purchase day book;</li> <li> purchase ledger; and</li> <li> nominal ledger. <strong>(O, C, A) </strong></li> </ul> <p><i>This test can be combined with the test on the P programme when all purchases are processed in the same way</i></p>', '', '', '', '2.16 R2-1', '2.16 R2-1', '35', 'Active', '2024-03-21 21:36:23')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>16. Where a material amount of goods or services are returned, ensure the corresponding credit notes are received and recognised in the financial statements. <strong>(C, A, CO)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.16 R2-1', '2.16 R2-1', '35', 'Active', '2024-03-21 21:36:23')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>17. Review financial liabilities to ensure that all which are recoverable after more than 12 months and do not carry a commercial rate of interest have been accounted for on an amortised cost basis and that the unwinding of the discount has been appropriately accounted for as an expense in profit or loss.</p>', '', '', '', '2.16 R2-1', '2.16 R2-1', '35', 'Active', '2024-03-21 21:36:23')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>18. List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>', '', '', '', '2.16 R2-1', '2.16 R2-1', '35', 'Active', '2024-03-21 21:36:23')

params.name: $head =
params.value: Other Expenditure  and Losses Audit Programme

post.question:
Array
(
    [0] => <p>1.	Obtain schedules for other expenditure and losses which include lead schedules for:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Distribution costs;</li>
    <li>Administrative expenses;</li>
    <li>Interest payable and similar charges. <strong>(P)</strong></li>
</ul>
    [1] => <p>2.	Ensure a schedule is prepared which separately shows expenses and losses recognised in profit or loss relating to financial instruments, split between:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Financial assets measured at fair value through profit or loss;</li>
    <li>Financial liabilities measured at fair value through profit or loss;</li>
    <li>Financial assets measured on an amortised cost basis; and </li>
    <li>Financial liabilities measured on an amortised cost basis. <strong>(P)</strong></li>
</ul>
    [2] => <p>3.	Agree the totals shown on the lead schedules to the trial balance. <strong>(A)</strong></p>
    [3] => <p>4.	Agree comparative figures to the previous period’s statutory financial statements.<strong> (P, C)</strong></p>
    [4] => <p>5.	Ensure that all items are correctly recognised in profit or loss rather than other comprehensive income.<strong> (P)</strong></p>
    [5] => <p>6.	Consider the appropriateness of the allocation of expenditure between the expense classifications noted above and also direct costs. <strong>(P)</strong></p>
    [6] => <p>7.	Review other expenses for reasonableness and consistency. <strong>(C)</strong></p>
    [7] => <p>8.	Revisit the risk assessment, materiality calculation and assignment plan and update as appropriate where matters have been identified during the assignment.</p>
    [8] => <p>9.	Ensure key findings from this section are included in the draft letter of representation, points for the management letter and points for A.E.P.’s attention.</p>
    [9] => <p>10.	Ensure that the conclusion is appropriate.<strong> (P)</strong></p>
    [10] => <p>11.	Consider the results of the scrutiny tests completed in the I section. <strong>(CL, A, P)</strong></p>
    [11] => <h6>Walkthrough</h6>
<p>12.	Undertake one walkthrough test for each system in operation (this must cover the transaction and associated controls).  Use the results, along with results of payables testing, to decide whether to replace some or all tests of detail with detailed analytical procedures. <strong>(A)</strong></p>
    [12] => <h6>Detailed analytical procedures</h6>
<p>13.	Perform detailed analytical procedures as applicable to the client.  E.g. proof in total, ratio analysis (comparing periods and similar entities). <strong>(C, CL, A)</strong></p>
    [13] => <h6>Tests of detail</h6>
<p>14.	Trace a sample of expenses from the nominal ledger (covering, administration, distribution and finance related costs) to either:</p>
<ul>
    <li>the purchase ledger and the purchase day book; or</li>
    <li>cash book; or</li>
    <li>journal book; and</li>
    <li>then to supporting documentation. <strong> (O, A)</strong></li>
</ul>
    [14] => <p>15.	For a sample of purchases trace from originating documents (orders, contracts etc.) and agree, where applicable to:</p>
<ul>
    <li>	goods received note;</li>
    <li>	purchase invoice;</li>
    <li>	purchase day book;</li>
    <li>	purchase ledger; and</li>
    <li>	nominal ledger. <strong>(O, C, A) </strong></li>
</ul>
<p><i>This test can be combined with the test on the P programme when all purchases are processed in the same way</i></p>
    [15] => <p>16.	Where a material amount of goods or services are returned, ensure the corresponding credit notes are received and recognised in the financial statements. <strong>(C, A, CO)</strong></p>
    [16] => <p>17.	Review financial liabilities to ensure that all which are recoverable after more than 12 months and do not carry a commercial rate of interest have been accounted for on an amortised cost basis and that the unwinding of the discount has been appropriately accounted for as an expense in profit or loss.</p>
    [17] => <p>18.	List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>
)

headers.User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/122.0.0.0 Safari/537.36
